description: From throw out, in the sense of having been thrown out of society.

entries.meaning: (printing) A folded sheet that opens out to one side; half a gatefold.
(rare) One who has been rejected by society; an outcast.
examples: The first category were throwouts of the Police Reserve and the prisons organization who avenged themselves on these bodies that had rejected them by inventing and spreading accusations of malpractices.

entries.meaning: (US, accounting) A practice to avoid untaxed nowhere income by instead assuming the untaxed transaction is taxed in the originating state in a notional proportion to other taxable transactions.
